errors.error_description: The installation command uses the incorrect package name 'py-wal' instead of the correct 'pywal16'.
correction_candidates:
You can install the latest release from PyPI:
`pip install pywal`

You can install the latest release from PyPI:
`pip install pywal16`

You can install the latest release from PyPI:
`pip install python-wal`

You can install the latest release from PyPI:
`pip install wal16`
errors.golden_answer:
You can install the latest release from PyPI:
`pip install pywal16`

errors.error_description: The command for applying a theme uses an incorrect flag '--apply-theme'.
correction_candidates:
To apply one of the built-in themes, run:
`wal -t "solarized-dark"`

To apply one of the built-in themes, run:
`wal --theme "solarized-dark"`

To apply one of the built-in themes, run:
`wal theme "solarized-dark"`

To apply one of the built-in themes, run:
`wal apply "solarized-dark"`
errors.golden_answer:
To apply one of the built-in themes, run:
`wal -t "solarized-dark"`
